intro: [WRONG START] Elaeidendron schweinfurthianum var. obovatum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its broad, obovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical and subtropical gardens.
